audio_create_play_queue: This function prepares a buffer queue for audio. You pass data format (only <tt>buffer_u8</tt> or <tt>buffer_s16</tt> are currently supported), the sample rate (which can be between 1000hz and 48000hz), and the channels that the audio requires from one of the constants listed below:
Note that you should free up any audio queues created with this function when no longer required to prevent memory leaks using the function audio_free_play_queue().

This function will trigger an Audio Playback Asynchronous Event when the queue has reached the end, and in this event a special DS map will be created in the variable async_load with the following key/value pairs:
"queue_id" - the queue that has finished playing data
"buffer_id" - the buffer that is no longer being played from

"queue_shutdown" - this is set to 0 during normal playback and 1 when the event is received because audio_free_play_queue() has been called. When this is set to 1, you don't want to queue up any further data.
The format of the buffer data to use (<tt>buffer_u8</tt> or <tt>buffer_s16</tt>).
The sample rate of the data in the buffer queue.
The channels to use from one of the constants listed below.
The above code creates a new audio queue and assigns its ID to a variable for future reference.
